Description:
1.Create data source in a report using sqlserver. Then create data set based on it.  
2.Binding Driver class, database URL ... to parameter.
3.Then preview it with new drivers as it;s parameter.
4.Action failed.

Steps:
1. create a report
2. set a data resource :Driver Class:net.sourceforge.jtds.jdbc.Driver (v0.9)
Database URL:jdbc:jtds:sqlserver://spmdb:1433/test
User Name:sa
Password:sa
3. set a dataset set. select all the field of the table "empolyee" 
4. create some parameters : P_DriverClass,P_DatabaseUrl,P_UserName,P_Password,P_QueryText
5. In the windows "Edit data  source", click the "Property Binding". 
     Input the  "params["P_DriverClass"]" in the input field of the "Driver Class",
     Input the  "params["P_DatabaseUrl"]" in the input field of the "Database URL",
     Input the  "params["P_UserName"]" in the input field of the "User Name",
     Input the  "params["P_Password"]" in the input field of the "Password" respectly.
6. In the windows "Edit data set", click the "Property Binding". 
     Input the  "params["P_QueryText"]" in the input field of the "QueryText",
7.  Insert the dataset into layout. Then preview it.
8.  Input "com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2Driver" in the "P_DriverClass"
input "jdbc:db2://spmdb:1527/gui" in the "P_DatabaseUrl"
input "root" in the "P_UserName"
input "root" in the "P_Password"
input "select * from ROOT.CUSTOMER" in the "P_QueryText'

Expected result:
The parameter can be used and the inputed data can be work. 
Data can be retrieved and displayed in report.

Actual result:
In my PC:
It operation very long tiime(Over 20 minutes), then error message pop up to tell about the virtual memory is too low. Then apllication hang.

In another PC:
Error messages bave been printed in the bottom.Please check:
